Package il.org.spartan.utils

Interface Rule<T,​R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - __ of elements for which the rule is applicable
    R - __ of result of applying this rule
    All Superinterfaces:
    Duplo<Rule<T,​R>>, java.util.function.Function<T,​R>, Recursive<Rule<T,​R>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Rule.CountingDelegator, Rule.Interceptor, Rule.Stateful
    public interface Rule<T,​R>
extends java.util.function.Function<T,​R>, Recursive<Rule<T,​R>>
    An abstract interface defining tippers, bloaters, and light weight pattern search, logging, computing statistics, etc.

    A rule is a Function that is augmented with:

    1. Typestate semantics: Protocol is call to @Rule.Check check(Object), and only then @Rule.Apply apply(Object).

      The order of method application must follow match the regular expression (CC*A?)*. This order is enforced by Rule.Stateful that, when possible, should be extended by clients.

      An instance can thus be in one of two states:

      1. ready(), which is the state after @Rule.Check method call, and a prerequisite for @Rule.Apply method call.
      2. not ready(), which is the initial state, and the state after a @Rule.Apply method call. .
    2. Aggregation: An instance of this class may be atomic, or compound, i.e., implementing Recursive. Method #descendants() returns a Stream of nested instances, which is an singleton of this if the instance is atomic, or include any number of instances, including
    3. Descriptive qualities: examples(), akas(), #describe(Object), #description(Object), and more.

    Note: In sub-classes the sub-interfaces methods marked @Rule.Check and @Rule.Apply are often overridden and marked final, while delegating to another (typically abstract) method. This other methods should be marked as either @Rule.Apply or @Rule.Check.

  • List of descriptive qualities requires re-thinking.
  • Convert @Rule.Check and @Rule.Apply into a single annotation, that takes an enum defined to include all state .
  • No method other than check(Object) should be allowed to take parameters. Defunct #describe(Object) and #description(Object).
Since:
2017-03-10
Author:
Yossi Gil
